definitions: located in or characteristic of the central business area of a city
relating to or characteristic of the main commercial and business district
examples: We took the subway to the downtown area
The downtown shops stay open until midnight
Downtown businesses are seeing increased foot traffic
She works at a downtown law firm

definitions: lacking a fixed, regular, and adequate nighttime residence or shelter
examples: The homeless population needs more support services
We volunteer at a homeless shelter every weekend

definitions: causing or feeling slight pain or physical discomfort
causing or feeling anxiety, embarrassment, or awkwardness in a situation
examples: These shoes are uncomfortable after walking all day
The uncomfortable chair made her back ache
The uncomfortable silence lasted for several minutes
He felt uncomfortable discussing his personal problems

definitions: having little color or a light shade compared to usual
lacking brightness, vividness, or strength of expression or effect
examples: Her pale skin burned easily in the sun
The walls were painted a pale blue color
His achievements pale in comparison to hers
The movie offered only pale imitation of the book

definitions: notably large in size, amount, or extent deserving attention or consideration
examples: The project required considerable time and effort
She has considerable experience in marketing

definitions: based on untested ideas or techniques and not yet established or finalized
relating to or based on experiment or experience rather than theory
examples: The restaurant serves experimental fusion cuisine
This experimental drug shows promising results
The experimental data confirmed our hypothesis
Scientists use experimental methods to test theories

definitions: having lived for a long time being old or aging
examples: The elderly woman needed help crossing the street
Many elderly residents live in this retirement community

definitions: being such in essence or effect though not formally recognized
existing or occurring on computers or on the internet rather than physically
examples: The company faced virtual bankruptcy before the bailout
His absence was a virtual guarantee of failure
Students attend virtual classes from home
The virtual reality game feels incredibly realistic

definitions: being the least or smallest amount or quantity possible, attainable, or required
examples: The minimum wage increased this year
You need minimum five years experience for this job

definitions: favoring or implementing social reform or new, liberal ideas and policies
happening or developing gradually or in stages over time
examples: The progressive politician supported healthcare reform
Progressive voters tend to support environmental policies
The disease showed progressive deterioration over months
We made progressive improvements to the design

definitions: physically strong, fit, and active with good muscle development
relating to athletes or athletics and physical sports activities
examples: She has an athletic build from years of training
His athletic ability impressed the scouts
The school offers many athletic programs
Athletic scholarships help students afford college

definitions: having the power to make laws or relating to the process of making laws
examples: The legislative branch consists of Congress
Legislative reform takes time and careful planning

definitions: relating to the sale of goods to the public in relatively small quantities
examples: Retail prices are higher than wholesale prices
She manages a retail clothing store downtown

definitions: happening or payable every month or once a month
examples: We have monthly team meetings on Fridays
The monthly rent payment is due tomorrow

definitions: causing or able to cause death or fatal harm
extremely boring or dull to an unbearable degree
examples: The snake's bite contains deadly venom
Drunk driving can have deadly consequences
The lecture was deadly dull and uninspiring
The party turned into a deadly boring affair

definitions: consistently good in quality or performance and able to be trusted
examples: She's a reliable employee who never misses work
This car brand is known for reliable engines

definitions: becoming different or undergoing alteration in form, nature, or character
examples: The changing seasons bring different weather patterns
Society has changing attitudes toward mental health

definitions: not making or conducted primarily to make a profit for charitable purposes
examples: The nonprofit organization helps feed homeless families
Many nonprofit groups rely on volunteer workers

definitions: having power and influence over others or being most important, powerful, or influential
examples: The dominant team won the championship easily
English is the dominant language in international business

definitions: connected with God or a god or dedicated to a religious purpose
regarded with great respect and reverence by a particular group
examples: The sacred texts contain ancient wisdom
They visited sacred sites during their pilgrimage
Freedom of speech is sacred in democracy
The forest is sacred to indigenous peoples

definitions: relating to Korea, its people, culture, or language
examples: Korean cuisine features kimchi and barbecue
She's studying Korean language at university

definitions: sexually attractive or exciting arousing sexual interest or desire
generally attractive or interesting in a way that suggests excitement
examples: The actor looked sexy in the designer suit
She wore a sexy dress to the party
The new sports car has sexy curves
That's a sexy job offer with great benefits

definitions: found or distributed over a large area or number of people
examples: The disease caused widespread panic across the region
There's widespread support for the new policy

definitions: relating to the running of a business, organization, or system of management
examples: She handles administrative duties like scheduling and filing
The administrative costs are increasing each year

definitions: feeling happy and satisfied about something that has happened or been done
examples: We're pleased with the election results
The teacher was pleased by student improvements

definitions: being the greatest in amount, size, or degree that is possible or allowed
examples: The elevator has a maximum capacity of ten people
Drive at maximum speed on the highway

definitions: sad or displeased because someone or something has failed to fulfill hopes or expectations
examples: She felt disappointed when the concert was cancelled
Parents were disappointed by the test scores

definitions: legally or officially acceptable and able to be used
based on truth or reason that is logical and convincing
examples: You need a valid passport to travel internationally
The parking ticket is valid for two hours
She made a valid point during the debate
His concerns about safety are perfectly valid

definitions: wanting to do or have something very much with keen interest
examples: The eager students raised their hands immediately
She's eager to start her new job

definitions: occurring or done on many occasions at short intervals
examples: Frequent flyer miles add up quickly
The bus makes frequent stops along this route

definitions: made of concrete building material consisting of cement, sand, and gravel
existing in a material or physical form that is specific and definite
examples: The concrete sidewalk needs repair
They poured concrete for the foundation
We need concrete evidence to prove the case
Give me a concrete example of the problem

definitions: relating to or typical of large organizations such as universities, banks, or hospitals
examples: The institutional investors control major market shares
Institutional racism requires systemic change to address

definitions: relating to ancient Rome or its empire, people, or culture
relating to the modern city of Rome or the Roman Catholic Church
examples: Roman soldiers built roads across Europe
The Roman Empire lasted for centuries
Roman architecture influences modern Italian design
The Roman Catholic Church has worldwide influence

definitions: having great knowledge or experience and good judgment about culture and fashion
highly developed and complex showing advanced form, technique, or technology
examples: The sophisticated audience appreciated the subtle humor
She has sophisticated taste in wine
The sophisticated software uses artificial intelligence
Modern phones are sophisticated communication devices

definitions: relating to moral principles or the branch of knowledge dealing with these
examples: Doctors must follow ethical guidelines
The company prides itself on ethical business practices

definitions: expressed or recorded in letters or words rather than spoken
examples: Please submit a written request for time off
The written exam is harder than the oral exam

definitions: persisting for a long time or constantly recurring especially of illness
examples: She suffers from chronic back pain
Chronic stress can damage your health

definitions: lasting or extending without interruption or occurring repeatedly over time
examples: The continued rain caused flooding
We appreciate your continued support

definitions: restricted or limited to a particular person, group, or area
excluding or not admitting other things or not including something
examples: The exclusive club has strict membership requirements
They signed an exclusive contract with the artist
These categories are mutually exclusive
The price is exclusive of taxes

definitions: connected with something else in a relationship or as a companion
examples: High blood pressure is associated with heart disease
The costs associated with travel keep increasing

definitions: different from or not similar to something or someone else
examples: Unlike his brother, he enjoys classical music
This year's weather is unlike last year's

definitions: extremely interesting and capable of attracting and holding attention completely
examples: The documentary told a fascinating story
She finds ancient history absolutely fascinating

definitions: providing the power, energy, or motivation to make something happen
relating to the control and operation of a motor vehicle
examples: Cost reduction was the driving force behind the changes
Her ambition is the driving factor in her success
The driving test includes parallel parking
Driving conditions were dangerous in the storm

definitions: characterized by constant change, activity, or progress in systems or processes
full of energy and new ideas showing positive attitude and enthusiasm
examples: The dynamic economy creates new opportunities
Weather patterns are dynamic systems
She's a dynamic speaker who engages audiences
The dynamic team leader motivates everyone

definitions: of great value because of rarity, cost, or personal significance
affectedly concerned with elegant refinement in an exaggerated way
examples: Time with family is precious
The museum displays precious artifacts
Her precious manner of speaking annoyed everyone
Don't be so precious about your work

definitions: not expected or regarded as likely to happen causing surprise
examples: The unexpected rain ruined our picnic plans
Her unexpected visit was a pleasant surprise

definitions: relating to the science or practice of farming and cultivation of land
examples: Agricultural subsidies support local farmers
The region depends on agricultural exports

definitions: satisfactory or acceptable in quality or quantity though not especially good
examples: The hotel provides adequate but basic accommodations
Do you have adequate insurance coverage?

definitions: ready to face and endure danger or pain showing courage
examples: The brave firefighter rescued the trapped child
It was brave of you to speak up

definitions: unpleasantly rough or jarring to the senses causing discomfort
cruel or severe in manner, attitude, or treatment lacking mercy
examples: The harsh winter wind stung their faces
Harsh chemicals can damage your skin
The judge gave a harsh sentence
Her harsh criticism hurt his feelings
